com.communote.server.core.crc

Class FilesystemConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.communote.server.core.crc.FilesystemConnector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MetadataRepositoryConnector, RepositoryConnector, Serializable

    public class FilesystemConnector
extends Object
implements MetadataRepositoryConnector
    A class for the ContentRepositoryConnector to use a file system.
    Author:
    Communote GmbH - http://www.communote.com/
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • FilesystemConnector

        public FilesystemConnector(RepositoryConnectorConfiguration connectorConfiguration)
                    throws IOException
        Constructor for a new FilesystemConnector, based on the given FilesystemConfiguration.
        Parameters:
        connectorConfiguration - The configuration for this connector.
        Throws:
        IOException - in case the the directory for storing the content cannot be created or exists and is not a directory or cannot be accessed

      • getRepositorySizeLimitRatio

        public float getRepositorySizeLimitRatio()
        Description copied from interface: RepositoryConnector
        Gets the ratio of the current repository size to the repository size limit. If there is no size limit 0 is returned.
        Specified by:
        getRepositorySizeLimitRatio in interface RepositoryConnector
        Returns:
        the ratio of current size to the repository size limit. 0 if there are no limits.

      • getRepositorySizeLimitRatio

        public float getRepositorySizeLimitRatio(long sizeOfNewDataToStore)
        Description copied from interface: RepositoryConnector
        Gets the ratio of the current repository size plus sizeOfNewDataToStore to the repository size limit. If there is no size limit 0 is returned.
        Specified by:
        getRepositorySizeLimitRatio in interface RepositoryConnector
        Parameters:
        sizeOfNewDataToStore - size of data in bytes
        Returns:
        the ratio of current size to the repository size limit. 0 if there are no limits.

      • updateMetadata

        public void updateMetadata(ContentMetadata metadata)
                    throws ContentRepositoryException
        Update the metadata of existing content with the provided metadata. The ContentId of the content to update is contained in the according metadata field.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Throws:
